intro: Phyllostegia arenicola, commonly known as the sand phyllostegia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its low water requirements, it is well adapted to drought conditions and is considered a hardy, resilient species.
